title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.32-34 | 10-01-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
segments.summary: The session begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: Arjuna at once retracted both the Brahmastra weapons and there was no more danger from that Brahmastra which Ashwathama had released.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Arjuna retracting the Brahmastra weapons, emphasizing Krishna's role in averting destruction.

segments.key_quote: Ultimately it all rests on the supreme will of the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the power of atomic weapons is insignificant compared to the will of the Supreme Lord, who ultimately controls everything.

segments.key_quote: Unless the Lord wills, it is not possible for anyone to destroy the entire world.
segments.summary: The speaker continues to emphasize the supreme power of the Lord and the insignificance of human power in comparison.
The speaker explains that the Devatas are agents of Krishna, working according to His instructions, reinforcing the idea that no one can destroy the planet without His will.

segments.key_quote: Arjuna, his eyes blazing in anger, like two red balls of copper, dexterously arrested the son of Gautami and bound him with ropes, like an animal.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Arjuna's anger and his act of arresting Ashwatthama, explaining that it was part of his duty (dharma).

segments.key_quote: It was not wrong on the part of Arjuna to bind Ashwatthama with ropes like an animal.
segments.summary: The speaker continues to justify Arjuna's actions and introduces the next verse where Krishna will speak to Arjuna.

segments.key_quote: Because Krishna is absolute, both his anger and pleasure are the same.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the difference between Arjuna's anger and Krishna's anger, emphasizing Krishna's transcendental nature and his concern for his devotees.
